document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Wang, Yalian, O’Grady, Patrick Michael, Su, Yirui & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part VIII: twenty-one species from the Oriental region, with morphological and molecular evidence

bibRefCitation.author: Okada, T.
bibRefCitation.refString: Okada, T. (1987) The Leucophenga proxima Species Group of Southeast Asia and New Guinea (Diptera, Drosophilidae). Kontyu, 55, 90 - 99.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 20.
Leucophenga sorii Kang, Lee & Bhang, 1965
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus, and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods, aedeagus, and aedeagal apodeme; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species strongly resembles
L . varinervis
in the colour patterns of abdominal tergites in both male ( Fig. 9G, I ) and female ( Fig. 9H, J ), and the shape of paramere ( Figs. 21C , 22C ), but can be distinguished from the latter in having the postocellar distinct ( Fig. 5M ); aedeagus apically hook-shaped, laterally mostly covered by its long process ( Fig. 21D ); see below for that species.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Leucophenga spinifera Okada, 1987
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. Epandrium, surstylus, and cercus; B. Hypandrium, paramere, gonopods, aedeagus, and aedeagal apodeme; C. Paramere; D. Aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.
